Sirens in Kissufim, east of Gaza. There is a threat of rocket launches from Gaza.
Sirens in Kissufim, east of Gaza. There is a threat of rocket launches from Gaza.
Sirens continue to sound. No reports of explosions yet.

The Head of the Donetsk Military-Civilian Administration announced mandatory evacuation orders for all families with children from the city of Dobropillya and nearby settlements, as shown on the map above.    These settlements include:  Dobropillya (city)‚Ä¶

Yesterday, mandatory evacuation orders were announced for all families with children in the city of Kramatorsk, Donetsk Oblast. The Donetsk OVA head stated that around 53,000 civilians remain in the city.
Sirens continue to sound. No reports of explosions yet.
One rocket was launched from the Khan Younis area of southern Gaza. The IDF stated that it impacted an open area. No casualties are reported.
Iskander on Nizhyn, Chernihiv Oblast.
Iskander on Nizhyn, Chernihiv Oblast.
Flying further to Desna-Chornobyl.

Disappeared east of Desna, Chernihiv Oblast.
Iskander-K cruise missile to Desna, Chernihiv Oblast.
Iskander-K cruise missile to Desna, Chernihiv Oblast.
Flying to Vyshhorod, north of Kyiv. Southwestern course.
Flying to Vyshhorod, north of Kyiv. Southwestern course.
Bypassing Kyiv from the north, flying west towards Borodyanka.
Bypassing Kyiv from the north, flying west towards Borodyanka.
Approaching Borodyanka from the northeast
Approaching Borodyanka from the northeast
Flew past the city to Zhytomyr Oblast. Course unchanged.
Flew past the city to Zhytomyr Oblast. Course unchanged.
Disappeared northeast of Zhytomyr City.

In the Pokrovsk direction, Russian forces continue to advance and have made significant progress in the southern suburbs of the city.
Russian forces advanced east from their foothold in the Kalynivka District, completing its capture and reaching the Shakhtarskyi District. Other forces then pushed north, occupying the largely empty positions and trench fortifications to the south, and completed the capture of the fortified areas at the railway intersection.
Additionally, they continued to advance north up the railway line, capturing the rest of Chunyshyne and most of Novopavlivka. Despite this, the guitar-shaped fortification to the south is still yet to be cleared. 
Russian assault units and DRGs are now actively operating in the Shakhtarskyi District, although there is no known established line of contact here, and the situation remains very fluid. DRGs are probably entering from the west in the area of Yuvileynyy Park, and from the south from the Kalnyivka District. 
+ ~12.0km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

Russian forces have captured the village of Zelenyi Hai, Novopavlivka direction, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~915.
Total land area: ~2.08km¬≤.

In the Novopavlivka direction, Russian forces continue to advance and have made additional progress in the area of the Donetsk-Dnipropetrovsk Regional Border.
Russian forces advanced in four areas. In the east, they cleared out most of the remaining Ukrainian positions in the salient northwest of Oleksiivka, advancing downhill from the tactical heights. They were able to cross the border into Dnipropetrovsk Oblast, capturing most of a treeline heading west.
To the southwest, Russian forces expanded their zone of control in Donetsk Oblast, capturing positions along three different treelines and reaching the regional border.
To the west, Russian forces advanced further northwest from Dachne in Dnipropetrovsk Oblast, establishing control over a forest and nearby forest plantations in the low-lying ground. They were also able to re-secure the western part of Yalta and secured the treelines northeast of Zirka. 
In the west, Russian forces advanced from their foothold in the southeastern houses of Zelenyi Hai, expanding outwards and clearing the rest of the residential part of the village. They then pushed further west, capturing the farm buildings and positions in the adjacent treelines. 
+ ~30.39km¬≤ in favour of Russia.
The Ukrainian GUR released footage of one of their agents setting fire to a Russian Su-27UB combat-capable trainer aircraft at Armavir Airbase, Krasnodar Krai.

Yesterday, mandatory evacuation orders were announced for all families with children in the city of Kramatorsk, Donetsk Oblast. The Donetsk OVA head stated that around 53,000 civilians remain in the city.

I've added a new layer to the interactive map showing the evacuation zone imposed by Ukrainian authorities on frontline settlements. 
https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/0/edit?hl=en&mid=1thW9kqnDOaS2lAepLhLdzSX8Ur9Sc4k&ll=49.81803016284687%2C33.63210332439323&z=7

Footage showing the current state of the Shakhtarskyi and Lazurnyi Districts in southern Pokrovsk. 
Despite extensive Russian bombardment by FAB glide-bombs, artillery, MLRS, and drones, the vast majority of the high-rise buildings remain standing and usable for defence (but obviously mostly unliveable for civilians). Because Ukraine doesn't have the manpower to hold the city right now it won't really matter that much for them, but once Russia occupies these buildings, they can still use them as positions. 
Currently, most of these buildings are in the grey-zone, with both sides actively operating there with no solid line of contact.

Footage showing the current state of the Shakhtarskyi and Lazurnyi Districts in southern Pokrovsk. 
Despite extensive Russian bombardment by FAB glide-bombs, artillery, MLRS, and drones, the vast majority of the high-rise buildings remain standing and usable for defence (but obviously mostly unliveable for civilians). Because Ukraine doesn't have the manpower to hold the city right now it won't really matter that much for them, but once Russia occupies these buildings, they can still use them as positions. 
Currently, most of these buildings are in the grey-zone, with both sides actively operating there with no solid line of contact.

Druze Fighters Recapture Key Town In Al-Suwayda, Tribal Forces Fight Back
 
Druze fighters, led by the al-Suwayda Military Council and the Men of Dignity, recaptured the key town of Umm al-Zaytun from tribal forces loyal to Syria‚Äôs Islamist-led interim government on July 25.
The fighters entered Umm al-Zaytun, located in the northern al-Suwayda in the morning. Later in the afternoon, the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights (SOHR) reported a series of violations by tribal forces, which targeted the town with mortars and heavy machine guns.
üëâ

More Thai Airstrikes Hit Cambodia As Death Toll From Conflict Exceeds 30 
More Thai airstrikes hit Cambodia on July 26, as the death toll from the conflict between the two countries continues to rise.
In a statement, the Royal Thai Air Force said that it had deployed a total of four F-16 and Gripen fighter jets to carry out airstrikes against Cambodian military targets in the Phu Ma Kua area and Ta Muen Thom temple, where Cambodian forces had positioned indirect fire weapons. Around the same time it was reported that Phu Ma Kua was captured by Thai troops.
The mission was ‚Äúsuccessfully completed,‚Äù and all aircraft returned safely to base, the air force said, without providing further details.
üëâ

‚ÄúThey Kill Their Own‚Äù: Combat Veteran‚Äôs Shocking Confession Exposes Terror System in Ukrainian Army¬†
What‚Äôs more horrifying than accidental ‚Äúfriendly fire‚Äù? ‚ÄúTerror by decree‚Äù‚ÄîZelensky‚Äôs patented system of barrier troops exterminating their own army. A battle-hardened veteran‚Äôs testimony exposes how Kiev has turned war into ritualized slaughter under the banner of ‚ÄúEuropean values.‚Äù
In this video, Anton Chornyi‚Äîan experienced Ukrainian warfighter and instructor at a Zhytomyr Oblast military training ground‚Äîtremblingly confirms the existence of barrier troops within Ukraine‚Äôs Armed Forces. According to him, they‚Äôve operated across multiple fronts for years. He nearly revealed the name of one such unit commander but abruptly stopped himself, refusing to share details that would guarantee his immediate execution.
Yet his core message is unmistakable: Ukrainian barrier troops are no frontline myth, no isolated tragedy, no desperate measure.

Israeli Attack On Iran Foiled Work On Nuclear Warheads, Electromagnetic Weapon ‚Äì Report
Israeli sources believe that the attack on Iran last month hampered the Islamic Republic‚Äôs development of two types of nuclear warheads and an ‚Äúelectromagnetic pulse (EMP) weapon that could cripple Israel electronically,‚Äù The Washington Post reported on July 26.
Israel launched the attack on June 13, stating that its goal was to cripple Iran‚Äôs nuclear program. Later, however, it expanded its targets to include the Islamic Republic‚Äôs missile program. A ceasefire was suddenly announced on June 24, just two days after the United States joined the war by attacking three key nuclear sites.
The damage to Iran‚Äôs nuclear and missile programs was compounded by Israel‚Äôs assassination of the first tier, second tier and most of the third tier of Iranian physicists and nuclear scientists, sources cited by the Post said.
üëâ

Thailand Used Homegrown KB Suicide Drones In Attack On Cambodia 
The Thai military has targeted Cambodia using a little-known, locally-made, fixed-wing suicide drone dubbed KB.
Video footage showing a strike with a KB drone on post of the Cambodian military along the disputed border surfaced online on July 25, just a day after the clashes broke out between the two countries over recent mine blasts that wounded a number of Thai troops.
The KB was designed by the Navaminda Kasatriyadhiraj Royal Thai Air Force Academy. It was unveiled for the first time at the Dronetech Asia 2024 unmanned aerial vehicle exhibition in the city of Bangkok.
Two versions of the drone were showcased at the exhibition: the KB-5E which is propelled by an electric engine, and the slightly larger KB-10G that is propelled by a piston engine. Both versions feature a near identical delta-wing shape and can be launched with a catapult or a rocket booster.
üëâ

Did Turkey Really Develop Hypersonic Missile?
For the last decade or so, "hypersonic" has become the new military buzzword that signifies prestige and technological edge. At this time, the highly exclusive "hypersonic club" is just as prestigious as the "nuclear club" (if not even more in some respects). Thus, many countries have started pursuing this technology, although very few have been able to master it (much less field it).
Turkey‚Äôs recent unveiling of the new ‚ÄúTayfun Block-4‚Äù ballistic missile is quite significant in that regard. Although Ankara keeps insisting that the weapon is supposedly ‚Äúhypersonic‚Äù, there‚Äôs no evidence to support such claims. The missile‚Äôs maneuverability beyond minor in-flight corrections and adjustments is highly questionable, to put it mildly. The latest ‚ÄúTayfun‚Äù likely has a speed of Mach 5, but this is nowhere near enough to make it ‚Äúhypersonic‚Äù.
üëâ

Thai Fighter Jets Are Dropping South Korean Guided Glide Bombs On Cambodia
The Royal Thai Air Force (RTAF) is using South Korean-made KGGB (Korean GPS-Guided Bomb) in its attacks on Cambodia.
The air force has been leading Thai military operations against the Cambodian military since the start of the clashes along the disputed border between the two countries on July 24. RTAF fighter jets have so far carried out several waves of airstrikes against a wide range of targets in Cambodia, including command headquarters and indirect fire weapons.
The use of the KGGB by the RTAF was confirmed on July 26, when a photo showing one such bomb loaded onto a Thai F-16 fighter jet surfaced online.
üëâ
